title: Rijal and Rijal Production: A Legacy in Motion
content: Rijal and Rijal Production, widely known as R&R Production, is more than just a film company—it's a movement that has reshaped the Nepali film industry. Founded with a passion for authentic storytelling, the production house has consistently pushed the boundaries of creativity and technology. From humble beginnings in Kathmandu to producing internationally acclaimed short films and full-length features, R&R has played a pivotal role in elevating the standards of Nepali cinema. Their early works focused on social realism and untold stories from rural Nepal, which quickly captured the attention of both local and global audiences. Today, R&R continues to champion bold narratives, nurture emerging talent, and invest in high-quality production techniques that rival international studios.
author: Suman Risal

title: Behind the Camera: The Creative Process at R&R Production
content: Every great film begins with a vision—and at Rijal and Rijal Production, that vision is nurtured by collaboration. From scriptwriting to post-production, R&R follows a meticulous creative process that emphasizes story-first thinking, cultural authenticity, and cinematic aesthetics. Directors and producers work closely with writers, researchers, and technical crews to ensure each frame serves a purpose. One hallmark of their workflow is the extensive use of table reads and location scouts before filming begins. Whether it's a political drama, a rural love story, or a surrealist experimental piece, the R&R team believes in grounding their stories in reality while exploring powerful emotional arcs. Their in-house mentorship program has also empowered a new generation of cinematographers, editors, and sound designers to bring fresh perspectives into the industry.
author: Ramesh Risal

title: Innovation in Nepali Cinema: R&R's Use of Technology and VFX
content: While the Nepali film industry has often lagged in adopting new technologies, Rijal and Rijal Production has embraced innovation with open arms. From drone cinematography in the Himalayas to CGI-enhanced dream sequences, R&R continues to redefine what’s possible in Nepali cinema. Their 2023 film ‘Antaral’ was the first to use volumetric capture for character duplication—an ambitious technical feat that stunned both critics and audiences. Moreover, R&R has invested heavily in virtual production environments, enabling them to shoot complex scenes in controlled settings while preserving visual authenticity. Their post-production facility in Lalitpur is now considered one of the most advanced in the country, attracting collaborations with international studios and streaming platforms.
author: Pratik Adhikari

title: Global Reach: How R&R Production Took Nepali Stories Worldwide
content: Rijal and Rijal Production has made it their mission to showcase Nepali stories on the global stage. With screenings at international festivals like Cannes, TIFF, and Busan, their films are now being subtitled in over 10 languages. Their documentary ‘Echoes of the Himalaya’ was nominated for Best International Feature at the Tokyo Documentary Awards and earned rave reviews for its poignant portrayal of climate change in the Himalayan belt. More recently, R&R has formed co-production deals with studios in Europe and South Asia, allowing them to bring cross-cultural stories to life. Through strategic distribution partnerships with Netflix, MUBI, and local OTT platforms, R&R ensures that their films reach diaspora communities and curious cinephiles around the world.
author: Anish Dhakal

title: Empowering Voices: R&R's Commitment to Inclusive Storytelling
content: Representation matters—and Rijal and Rijal Production takes this seriously. Their storytelling model is deeply rooted in inclusion, both in front of and behind the camera. Their recent anthology film ‘Suno’, which featured five short films directed by women from diverse ethnic backgrounds, was celebrated as a breakthrough moment in Nepali cinema. Beyond gender and caste diversity, R&R actively works with indigenous communities, ensuring that cultural narratives are told with dignity and precision. In terms of employment, they’ve made a conscious effort to train crew members from underrepresented backgrounds in sound engineering, camera operation, and production design. This approach has not only created a more inclusive work culture but has also led to more nuanced, authentic storytelling.
author: Pratibha Shah

title: The Future of R&R: What Lies Ahead for Rijal and Rijal Production
content: Looking ahead, Rijal and Rijal Production is preparing for its most ambitious chapter yet. With plans to build Nepal’s first sustainable film village in Pokhara, R&R aims to create a self-contained ecosystem for film production, complete with sound stages, post-production labs, and artist residencies. They're also expanding into web series and interactive content formats, targeting younger audiences on platforms like YouTube, TikTok, and OTT streaming apps. Their upcoming sci-fi thriller ‘Shunya’, set in a near-future Kathmandu, is already generating buzz for its innovative narrative structure and high-concept world-building. Beyond the projects themselves, R&R plans to continue mentoring emerging filmmakers through the ‘R&R Academy’, a training program that bridges the gap between local talent and global opportunities.
author: Kiran Yadav
